content.description:
climbaz.com/Backcountry/pagâ€¦

  30' of face climbing brings you two a couple great cam placements in horizontal cracks. A few more moves get you to the first bolt and the start of the dike system. Stem, pinch, and crimp your way past bolts to a stance in front of a crack system and the end of the dike. Place a few cams or nuts here and climb easy terrain to the top. A typical Cochise ending, there is no pro available in this last 20 or so feet of this climb. With some help from your belayer, you can descend with just one 60 meter rope.
content.location: First (and only?) route on the Crisis Center. Located low on the formation, just across the gully from the Sheephead route Stampede.

content.description: This route is well worth doing if you are not afraid to use full length runners where the route zigs right and again where it zigs back left.  If you don't you will end up with heinous rope drag.  The pro is good and the route is fairly sustained.
content.protection: Doubles of everything exceept 3 & 4 camalots, one each will do.  Also has some bolts up high.
content.location: Obvious left angling weakness left of the white dike that is Sheep Thrills

content.description: When looking at Sheepshead dome, the Crisis Center is the lower formation located to the right, just across the gully from Stampede.
